intro: Haplocarpha ovata, commonly known as the broadleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are broad, heart-shaped, and often have a waxy coating, while its flowers are yellow and produce wind-dispersed seeds. Haplocarpha ovata is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its use in traditional herbal medicine.
